1 #!/usr/bin/env python3
2 ''' Independent '''
3 from .search_utils import PriorityQueue
4 from tamu_sa.graphs.grid_utils import get_index
5 from tamu_sa.graphs.grid_utils import get_world
6 
7 from tamu_sa import run_config as rc
8 if rc.visualize:
9  import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
10 import numpy as np
11 import time
12 
13 ''' Dependecies '''
14 from tamu_sa.animation.animation import Animate
15 
16 import pdb
17 
18 class Search:
19  def __init__(self, graph, start, goal):
20  self.graph = graph
21  self.start = start
22  self.goal = goal
23 
24  def set_start(self, start):
25  self.start = start
26 
27  def set_goal(self, goal):
28  self.goal = goal
29 
30 class AStarSearch(Search):
31  def __init__(self, graph, start, goal, h_type, inflation = 1.0, visualize=False):
32  Search.__init__(self, graph, start, goal)
33  self.h_type = h_type
34  self.inflation = inflation
35  self.visualize = visualize
36 
37  # A star initialize openList, closedList
38  self.frontier = PriorityQueue() # The OPENLIST
39  self.frontier.put(self.start, 0) # PUT START IN THE OPENLIST
40  self.parent = {} # parent, {loc: parent}
41  # g function dict, {loc: f(loc)}, CLOSED LIST BASICALLY
42  self.g = {}
43  self.parent[self.start] = None
44  self.g[self.start] = 0
45 
46  # Visulization?
47  if self.visualize:
48  # initialize plot (graph has the dimensions built it)
49  xlim = (graph.grid_dim[0], graph.grid_dim[1]) #(minX, maxX)
50  ylim = (graph.grid_dim[2], graph.grid_dim[3]) #(minY, maxY)
51  self.grid_size = graph.grid_size
52  self.grid_dim = (xlim[0], xlim[1], ylim[0], ylim[1])
53  # 50 millisecond sleep
54  self.animateCurrent = Animate(number=1, xlim=xlim, ylim=ylim, gridSize=1,linewidth=5, markerType='xc', markerSize=10, sleep=0.000, order=10)
55  self.animateNeighbors = Animate(number=1, xlim=xlim, ylim=ylim, gridSize=1,linewidth=5, markerType='o', markerSize=5, sleep=0.000, order=-1)
56  self.animatePath = Animate(number=1, xlim=xlim, ylim=ylim, gridSize=1,linewidth=5, markerType='o', markerSize=5, sleep=0.000, order=-1)
57 
58 
59  ''' heuristic function '''
60  def heuristic(self, a, b, type_='manhattan'):
61  '''
62  General Idea
63  4 neighbors: manhattan
64  8 neighbors: diagonal
65  any direction: euclidean
66  '''
67  (x1, y1) = a
68  (x2, y2) = b
69  if type_ == 'manhattan':
70  return abs(x1 - x2) + abs(y1 - y2)
71  elif type_ == 'euclidean':
72  v = [x2 - x1, y2 - y1]
73  return np.hypot(v[0], v[1])
74  elif type_ == 'diagonal_uniform':
75  return max(abs(x1 - x2), abs(y1 - y2))
76  elif type_ == 'diagonal_nonuniform':
77  dmax = max(abs(x1 - x2), abs(y1 - y2))
78  dmin = min(abs(x1 - x2), abs(y1 - y2))
79  return 1.414*dmin + (dmax - dmin)
80 
81  def use_algorithm(self):
82  ''' Usage:
83  - call to runs full algorithm until termination
84 
85  Returns:
86  - a linked list, 'parent'
87  - hash table of nodes and their associated min cost, 'g'
88  '''
89 
90  frontier = self.frontier
91  parent = self.parent
92  g = self.g
93 
94  while not frontier.empty():
95  current = frontier.get() # update current to be the item with best priority
96 
97  if self.visualize:
98  # Update plot with visuals
99  self.animateCurrent.update(current)
100  #self.animateCurrent.update(get_world(current[0], current[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim))
101 
102  # early exit if we reached our goal
103  if current == self.goal:
104  break
105  # expand current node and check neighbors
106  for next in self.graph.neighbors(current):
107  g_next = g[current] + self.graph.cost(current, next)
108  # if next location not in CLOSED LIST or its cost is less than before
109  # Newer implementation
110  if next not in g or g_next < g[next]:
111  g[next] = g_next
112  if self.h_type == 'zero' or self.goal == None:
113  priority = g_next
114  else:
115  priority = g_next + self.inflation*self.heuristic(self.goal, next, self.h_type)
116  frontier.put(next, priority)
117  parent[next] = current
118 
119  if self.visualize:
120  self.animateNeighbors.update(next)
121  #self.animateNeighbors.update(get_world(next[0], next[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim))
122 
123  #if self.visualize:
124  # fig.canvas.flush_events()
125 
126  #self.parent = parent
127  #self.g = g
128  return parent, g
